start.speaker: Rill
start.text:
Sometimes your oars are in mud. Sometimes they’re in blood.

Choose what line you won’t cross—or choose who pays when you do.

choices.text: Keep it clean. No one gets sacrificed.
Do what’s necessary to get someone out alive.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Rill’s gaze stays on you a moment too long. She’s memorizing your habits, the way a ferryman memorizes currents.
